Idioms.definition: Which means, watch multiple episodes of a television programme in succession.
Which means, an open-handed slap in the face intended to be humiliating.

Idioms.phrase: Bite off more than you can chew
Idioms.definition: Which means, take on a task that is more than one can manage.
Which means, die, especially in a violent or sudden way.
Which means, avoid speaking.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for sister.
Which means, family loyalties are stronger than those to other people.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for fart.
Which means, a set meal provided at a reduced price.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for face.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for arse.
Which means, died, especially in a violent way which may give rise to an insurance claim.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for pissed.
Which means, extremely cold weather. The full expression is 'Cold enough to freeze the balls off a brass monkey'.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for facts.
Which means, a superstitious way to wish 'good luck' to an actor before a performance while avoiding saying 'good luck' out loud, which is considered unlucky.
Which means, slogan of breastfeeding campaign.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for daughter.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for queer (i.e. homosexual).
Which means, perform to the best of your ability.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for dead.
Which means, 1. A partial failure of the electricity supply. 2. The exposing of one's buttocks in public.
Which means, child's play idiom expressing the sound of a vehicle.
Which means, a list of things you plan to do before you 'kick the bucket' (die). Often a list of fanciful ideas rather than of concrete plans.
Which means, to work late into the night.
Which means, dance in a stylish way.
Which means, waste money by purchasing a car that is frequently faulty.
Which means, twelve months beginning from the first of January.
Which means, unable to meet the demands put upon you.
Which means, boorish behaviour by rank and file police or soldiers.
Which means, a measure of the amount of carbon dioxide (CO2) emitted during an industrial or domestic process.
Which means, latin expression meaning seize the day.
Which means, said to be possessed by someone who is able to eat anything with no ill effects.
Which means, a question addressed to someone who is inexplicably silent. The implication is that the person's tongue is missing.
Which means, finding it difficult to choose between two alternatives.

Idioms.phrase: Caught by the short hairs (or short and curlies)
Idioms.definition: Which means, trapped by an opponent in a situation you can't escape.
Which means, the American spelling for the piece of furniture known elsewhere as a chaise longue.
Which means, stiffness or cramp in the arm or leg.
Which means, of a man pursuing women.
Which means, side by side; close together.
Which means, something of little importance, especially a small sum of money.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for pipe.
Which means, verbally scold someone.

Idioms.phrase: Children should be seen and not heard
Idioms.definition: Which means, old proverb suggesting that children should not impinge on the adult world.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for mate.
Which means, begin to eat.
Which means, a bicycle designing especially for urban riding.
Which means, an eye catching word or image on a website.
Which means, very near to success but falling short.
Which means, an imaginary idealistic state where everything is perfect. It is usually used with reference to someone who has an overly optimistic and unrealistic belief.
Which means, an unbelievable tale.
Which means, slang term for a computer programmer.

Idioms.phrase: Cold enough to freeze the balls off a brass monkey
Idioms.definition: Which means, extremely cold weather. The full expression is 'Cold enough to freeze the balls off a brass monkey'.
Which means, despite any great difficult or obstacle.
Which means, women forced into sexual slavery by the Japanese in WWII.
Which means, a worker especially loyal to the employer he works for.
Which means, adopt an aggressive stance.
Which means, a road that is ridged and furrowed like the fabric.
Which means, an upmarket hotel located in a revamped rural mansion.
Which means, make someone laugh.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for knackered. - note, when this term was coined, cream crackers were a popular snack in the UK.

Idioms.phrase: Cross that bridge when you come to it
Idioms.definition: Which means, deal with a problem if and when it becomes necessary, not before.
Which means, to hope that something happens.
Which means, the period of time just before a project has to be completed.
Which means, intentionally raise a false alarm.
Which means, being inquisitive can lead you into a dangerous situation.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for sun.
Which means, doing things in a slipshod way, to avoid expense or effort.
Which means, leave out all the unnecessary details and get straight to the point.
Which means, the dull daily routine.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for boots.
Which means, the rape by a man of his partner on a date.
Which means, minor surgery that does not require the patient to stay in hospital overnight.
Which means, the adjustment of clocks to provide longer evening daylight.
Which means, an exact duplicate.
Which means, derogatory reference to someone who has an unjustified reputation.
Which means, someone who agrees not to drink alcohol at a social event in order to be sober enough to drive others home.
Which means, 1. Adjust a device to reduce sound or temperature. 2. Reduce one's emotional reaction to something.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for shirt.
Which means, euphemism for sex.
Which means, cockney rhyming slang for telephone.
Which means, the hottest days of the summer season.
Which means, 1. Cockney rhyming slang for ears. 2. A very long time.

Idioms.phrase: Don't bite the hand that feeds you
Idioms.definition: Which means, don't hurt someone that helps you.

Idioms.phrase: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
Idioms.definition: Which means, don't count on receiving some benefit until you actually have it.
Which means, don't fret pointlessly about some mistake or loss when it can't be remedied.

Idioms.phrase: Don't give up the day job
Idioms.definition: Which means, said to someone who is a poor performer at a task - suggesting that they wouldn't be able to succeed at it professionally.

Idioms.phrase: Don't look a gift horse in the mouth
Idioms.definition: Which means, when you receive a gift accept it with good grace and don't find fault with it.

Idioms.phrase: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
Idioms.definition: Which means, don't risk all your property on a single venture.
Which means, denim jeans worn with a denim shirt or jacket.
Which means, a sports expression denoting two events held at the same time.
Which means, not decided until the very last minute.
Which means, very smartly dressed, in one's best clothes.
Which means, drink very heavily.
Which means, irritate or annoy very much.
Which means, many people either falling ill or dying.
Which means, a rehearsal.
Which means, a work day which an employee is allowed to spend at home relaxing.
Which means, sound that is loud or that catches the attention.
Which means, something that is extremely easy. Often used by children. Sometimes used by adults to demote an achievement that was accomplished with little apparent effort.
Which means, referring to an item on a menu that is no longer available.
